qas.question: What is the name for O3 most often used?
Of what is ozone a reactive part of oxygen?
What  does ozone's characteristic to cause damage effect?
What function does ozone perform for the planet?
What light radiation does ozone absorb?
What is another term for the upper atmosphere?
What was proven in 2001 in regard to the solid oxygen phase?
What was discovered in 2006 in regard to O4?

context:
<a0_3>Trioxygen<a0_3/> (O
3) is usually known as <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>ozone<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> and is a very reactive <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4>allotrope<a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> of oxygen that is damaging to <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><a2_4>lung<a2_3/> tissue<a2_4/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. <a0_4><b6_0>Ozone<b6_0/><a0_4/> is produced in the upper atmosphere when O
2 combines with atomic oxygen made by the splitting of O
2 by <a4_1><a4_3><a4_4>ultraviolet<a4_4/><a4_1/> (UV)<a4_3/> radiation. Since ozone absorbs strongly in the <a4_0><a4_2>UV<a4_2/><a4_0/> region of the spectrum, the ozone layer of the upper atmosphere functions as <a3_4>a <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>protective <a3_3>radiation shield<a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> for the planet. Near the Earth's surface, it is a pollutant formed as a by-product of automobile exhaust. The metastable molecule tetraoxygen (O
4) was discovered in 2001, and was assumed to exist in one of the six phases of solid oxygen. It was proven in 2006 that this phase, created by pressurizing O
2 to 20 GPa, is in fact a rhombohedral O
8 cluster. This cluster has the potential to be a much more powerful oxidizer than either O
2 or O
3 and may therefore be used in rocket fuel. A metallic phase was discovered in 1990 when solid oxygen is subjected to a pressure of above 96 GPa and it was shown in 1998 that at very low temperatures, this phase becomes superconducting.
